utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Nice tie.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Are you at least gonna call the cops this time?

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Come on, Dad. Let Rodrigo do this. Your arthritis is obviously—

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: I can pick up my own lawn.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: You know, if you wanted, you could put an end to all this.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Oh, of course. There are other ways to save the company. I'm only moving it to China because I'm craving egg foo yung.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: You know, I just got off the phone with some investors.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Yes, and they want a controlling interest.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: We get to stay here with the people who've been so loyal to this company. Everyone keeps their jobs.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: It's been a family business for 120 years. There's no way that I'm letting…

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Dad?

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: I need you to drive me to a doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This would totally suck.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Patient's visited China a lot recently. What about the JBE virus?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why don't you check his vaccination record before you make another stupid… O.M.F.G. 50% off cupcakes. How sick is the patient? 'Cause this expires today.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Central serous retinopathy. It's linked to type "A" personalities.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Funduscopic exam was normal. If you don't let me read my email, then I won't be able to read the email to the entire staff. From your ex-boss. Thank you. "Last month, I had an incident involving another P.P.T.H. employee. Though I can't speak to the details of the case while my disciplinary hearing is pending, I want you to know that I have completed voluntary sexual harassment training. And on a personal note, if my actions caused anyone distress, I sincerely apologize." You are so fired.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What? He apologized.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What? Because he said he apologized? He's saying he's sorry that someone, namely you, overreacted — namely, by punching him.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He grabbed my behind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Word is it was a celebratory slap after you completed your first-ever AVM embolization.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He grabbed it, he apologized for grabbing it, and now he's taking classes because he grabbed it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The classes make him sympathetic. Which, in turn, makes his unrepentant attacker… Evil. Which, in turn, in turn, makes you so fired.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: 100 bucks says I won't get fired.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, you don't wanna bet me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're fired.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I… The bet is—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But I thought—

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: After… Then I… Oh—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If only—

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: The bet's that I'll get fired after my hearing!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll take that action too, but you're already a C-note in the hole.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're late.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Considering I don't work here, arguably, I'm early.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pearl earrings? Knee-length dress. That's not a very shameful walk of shame.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I was at a job interview.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hope it went terribly.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Thad Barton? We only help rich white guys?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am an equal opportunity exploiter. I only help those who can help myself. I have a department to re-fund.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Atropine poisoning. He's moving his company to China, and his employees are hanging him in effigy. Could have moved on to the real thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pupils are normal.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Thyrotoxicosis?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not… a terrible idea. I'm gonna go give him P.T.U. and T.L.C. I have no idea what that second one stands for.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Things don't seem small anymore, they— I woke up from a nap and, uh, everything went from really small to really huge.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, then, these giant balls of medicine are not gonna work anymore. The change actually makes things simpler. Your occipital lobe is acting up, giving you a migraine.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: I don't have a headache.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not all migraines present that way. It's called Alice in Wonderland syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I never joke. Good news is, it's treatable with medication. Bad news is… it can make you very, very late for very important dates. I sometimes joke.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Thank you, Doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, if you really want to thank me, my department's not really a department. 'Cause my boss says he doesn't have the money. Which provides a nice contrast… with you.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: trying to find money in our budget so we don't have to move our operations overseas.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I get it. Answer's no. Shouldn't have said anything. I'm just glad that the symptoms showed up before you left for China. 'Cause I'm not sure the doctors over there would be so optimistic, considering… How they look down on mental illness.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: You speak Mandarin?

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: What are you guys talking about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, just how different the two cultures are. For example, our opinions on mental illness. Here, it's considered a normal and treatable condition. There, it’s taboo enough to destroy a high profile business deal.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Everything's fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’d never breach confidentiality, but… I could have you checked into a facility that exclusively treats mental disorders. How does that sound?

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Whatever's gonna get him better.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Let's try the medication first. How much do you want?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're hired! Oh, you guys are gonna love Doctors Chase and Taub. Keep your Nazi sentiments quiet around the little one.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You got the money? How?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Patient's a smart businessman.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He's destroying thousands of jobs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Jobs are not being destroyed. They're being relocated. The fact that you see that as inherently bad means you're an irrational patriot. To put it another way, a patriot.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Patriotism is natural. We've always relied on our tribes to keep us safe. It's helpful for society if its members have positive feelings about that society.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Iranian women. Drag Queens in Uganda. Patriotism is nothing but loyalty to real estate, real estate that's been conquered 800 times by 800 different regimes with 800 different cultures. But each time, it's just the best. I claim this burger in the name of Queen Isabella of Spain.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'll go check on the patient. I have Hepatitis C.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: She got it from me.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Hey, how's my dad doing?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Ah, great. His vision's back to normal, and if he remains asymptomatic through the night, we'll be able to release him in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No offense, but, uh, I think it's terrible your dad's closing down all your American operations.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: I don't think he's moving the company out of greed. He's moving it out of grief. My mom, she died four months ago. Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, and… It's been hard for him — living in their house, driving down the same streets. I mean, he's constantly reminded of her.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Dad?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I need an intubation kit in here!

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Angiography showed a hemorrhagic site in the left lower lobe.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I think it could be hyperviscosity syndrome. Are you sure Foreman's okay with this thing in his office?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's never gonna know. He's actually in here right now.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Blood count and protein count are normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think it could be hyperviscosity syndrome. Sorry, but after Park sent out here hospital-wide non-apology apology this morning, I assume that plagiarism is the new black.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: If it makes Andrews look sympathetic…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Copying him makes you look pathetic. And I will pay you not to go to anger management classes.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What about another clotting problem? Factor 5 Leiden deficiency.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's possible. Adams is the one who needs to deal with her anger.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Myelodysplastic syndrome.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I heard about your conversation with the patient's daughter. You were hostile.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Well, their company's making a decision I strongly disagree with.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yet you were never anything but courteous to the racists and rapists in prison. Those guys made decisions you supported?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Myelodysplastic syndrome.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm guessing it has something to do with the funeral you attended yesterday morning.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I was at a job interview.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got to work at 9:15. Closest hospital with an opening in your specialty is 45 minutes away. It's not possible. My condolences.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I wasn't at a funeral.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That just leaves… everywhere but a job interview.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who goes there? Reveal yourself!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, we would. But Orthopedics is still squatting in two thirds of my office, which is weird, 'cause you got a large check last night.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: From a corporation that's going through a very public belt-tightening. Means this donation was given under duress. Patient didn't tell me the whole story, but he did say he'd be thrilled if we didn't cash this. Got a policy review meeting in here in five minutes. Good-bye.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Holding your ass. You really didn't know?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: House…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just trying to help you out here. I figure for sure he'd punch me in the face, thus proving it's a natural response. My God, you have super-human discipline. And glutes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Get your hands off me.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Why… did you do that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We have a bet.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: But he's the chair of the disciplinary committee. Forget about the bet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You two really need to do your homework with me. Treat the patient with activated protein c.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: If he has myelodysplastic syndrome, he'll bleed out.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: And if he has Factor 5 Leiden deficiency, he'll throw another clot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly. It's a conclusive test. There's no actual risk. As long as you're both paying attention, and are both good enough to work here.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: I hear one of you thinks I'm a real bastard.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I guess that would be me.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Your boss uses blackmail, and you question my professional ethics?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Will you be instituting worker safety regulations in your new factories?

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Oh, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What about juice boxes in the break room for the children you'll be hiring?

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Charges of child exploitation against American companies have been blown

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: My ten-year-old cousin lives near Cebu City. Works at an American factory.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I am so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's the best thing for him. It sucks, but the Filipino factories suck worse, and the schools would suck if they existed. So this is the family's best hope. Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Is this supposed to itch like this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Itching. Interesting.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Not interesting. Already went away.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doubly interesting. Means we have to explain the arrival and the departure.

utterance.speaker: Ortho doctor
utterance.content: That's real mature, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What do you mean? This is outlandishly childish. I custom-built this puppy. It's got 106 leds, each one sending light to your eyes, slightly different wavelength.

utterance.speaker: Ortho doctor
utterance.content: Turn that off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Different wavelengths are stimulating your autonomic nervous system. That's what's making you feel like you're on a boat in choppy waters.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh ho ho! Cool.

utterance.speaker: Ortho doc
utterance.content: You think I'm not — you think I'm not gonna go to Foreman with this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, you will. And… I'll deny it, and he'll believe you. But then these two believe that the policy of protecting American jobs starts at home. So they'll never testify against me. And you won't be able to prove anything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now, if I punched him in the face, that he could prove.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I remember you saying something about how loyalty to real estate was stupid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is about reclaiming stolen property! Loyalty to real estate is stupid, because loyalty is stupid.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: First patriotism, now loyalty. You hate ice cream too?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: French vanilla, yeah. To willfully identify yourself as something else is a perversion of self-expression.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I had a thought. Other than the fact that loyalty is the basis of all meaningful relationships. The daughter said that her mother died of non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. What if she was misdiagnosed?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dutch chocolate's not bad. Gotta give 'em that.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Her lymphoma could have been caused by a virus, HTLV-1, which our patient contracted through having sex with his wife.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: In other words, loyalty gave him cancer. I like it. Start him on radiation.

utterance.speaker: Asian man
utterance.content: Chang and Eng Bunker. It's the most famous conjoined twins in history. 2011 is the bicentennial of their birth.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The best Halloween costumes are always the ones that need an explanation. What took you so long? I already lost one of them.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You need help with the lacerations?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I think I got palliative. Why don't you take preventative?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Prevent what? He got in a fight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which he started. Which means he's both irascible and stupid.

utterance.speaker: Asian man
utterance.content: I told the drunk, racist frat guy the proper term is "conjoined twin," not "Siamese."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can't comment on the drunk or the frat. But Chang and Eng were both, in fact, born in Siam. And they were, in fact, twins. If your name was Richard, it would be okay for me to call you a Dick. But maybe some of the tripe you learn in anger management class might help keep this guy out of here the next time.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Sometimes, it's incredibly satisfying to wind up and punch someone who really deserves it. But when you think about the consequences—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, let's go.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I thought you wanted me to help him with his anger.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I got everything I need.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Sometimes…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sometimes… It's incredibly satisfying to wind up and punch someone who deserves it. Wonder what the committee's gonna make of that.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: This is a waste of time. There's no way that Robin gave me an STD.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I know this is hard, and I'm sorry about your wife. If you'd like to talk to someone, we do have grief counselors at the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: You sound like my daughter. I miss my wife, but it's not driving my decision-making.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You were CEO since 1988. You decided to move your company right after your wife died. It stands to reason that your emotions factored in.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: My wife… is the only thing that keeps me here. I visit her grave once a week.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: So your daughter was wrong. You just… really need a lot of money.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: You ever hear of Kongo Gumi? Construction company in Japan founded in the year 578. Family-owned and operated. Building Buddhist temples for 50 generations. Wen—went bankrupt five years ago. You have any idea how that last CEO must have felt? Sorry, I… have to move.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Your heart rate is speeding up. Do you feel any tightness in your chest?

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: Yes, I figured it was from the radiation.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I think you're having a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Dr. Wilson… I need your advice. Um… I bet House $100 that I wouldn't get fired after my disciplinary hearing. Ever since then, he's been acting like he's actually trying to get me fired.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's because he is actually trying to get you fired.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Does he hate me?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not sure that's relevant to the equation.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: So it's really over $100?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not sure the amount is relevant. He's fighting for his honor.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He'll ruin my career.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not sure that's-

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What if I bet him $200 I will get fired.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He sees competing debts with the same person as a disgrace to the game. He'll be even more motivated to beat you.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: If you were me, what would you do?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You have to give him something he values more than honor. And you should update your resume.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: EKG and troponins were equivocal. It's not even clear if our patient just had a heart attack or what it was.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let's look at segmental wall motion abnormalities. Get him an echo to confirm. I need $200,000. His company's lost one third of its value since he was admitted.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And you want to do some insider trading? I take it felonies aren't a violation of your parole?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not insider trading. Just betting on myself to solve the case. Once we cure him, share price goes up, I pay you back.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, you don't say "no." You… make a counter offer.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'm not loaning my boss money.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. I'll make you a counter. $100,000. $20,000. I'll buy options instead of shares. More risk, but more upside. But that's as low as I'm gonna go.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I could do $5,000.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? No backsies.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: If… you double your clinic hours. Six a week. I've seen how you disrespect those patients.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you want twice as many of them disrespected?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Spend more hours with them, you'll treat them more humanely.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And this time, a land war in Russia will be a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Deal?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Here's what I'm thinking. You went to a parole hearing, where one of your old patients was denied. Hence the attire, hence the tardiness. And, most important, hence the anger. You think you can restore the cosmic balance by doing extra good here. More annoyingly, by having me do it. And deal!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course, you know… this means war.

utterance.speaker: Ortho doctor
utterance.content: Oh, I know. I mean, you'll escalate, and then I'll retaliate, and the cycle will continue until we've both gone too far, at which point, I'll… maybe get suspended and… you'll go back to prison. Happy pranking.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Patient had V-tach in the echo lab, so we capped him, but… coronary arteries were clean.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: If the plumbing's fine, check the electrical. EP study.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice idea. Even has a metaphor in it. Not worth more than my honor. But delightful, all the same.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm not going to lose. My college roommate is the editor of the Yale Law Review. She's writing my opening statement.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You will be eloquent in your loss. This case boils down to he said, she said. He said, "I've been working at this hospital for 15 years and I'm taking self-improvement classes." She said, "I've been a fellow for two months, and I'm kind of weird."

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No, he said, "I'm a drunk idiot who thinks he can grab girls' behinds without ramifications."

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Wait, he was drunk? In the hospital?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I already told Foreman he'd been drinking that night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Andrews was taking sexual harassment classes, not AA. That means he didn't get in trouble for drinking. Which means that Foreman signed off on it, which means that he set all the wheels in motion. Forget that. Wild speculation. Go do the EP study.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You already knew Andrews was drinking that night, didn't you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I think you should cancel my hearing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I hope this isn't going where I assume it's going.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You're the one who brought Andrews in. You set the wheels in motion.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We had a patient who was going to die without an AVM embolization. Andrews… was the only neurologist I could reach. He told me had a few glasses of wine, and that he shouldn't do it, but he also said that you were good. You were ready to do one, as long as you were supervised. So we agreed that he would come in, but wouldn't touch the patient.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I can understand the rationalization. We'll see if the Board agrees when I tell them the whole story at my hearing

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I already did. I had a closed session hearing last week. The Board decided to dock me two weeks pay.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Been working for House for two weeks. It's already too long.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No sign of any electrical abnormalities in the right atrium.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm so dead. I-I think House set me up. Have you sent the committee a character reference for me?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I thought you don't like favors.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I don't like gifts. It wouldn't be a gift. I would just be you telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I hardly know you.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: O2 sat is 89. Did we perforate? Is he tamponading?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Heart rate's only 90. Neck veins are flat.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Then why isn't he saturated?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Seems healthy to me. Let's release him. My option to sell Barton Foods at $34 is about to expire. So they thought the patient would be better by now. Instead, I am going to lose $20,000.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your five plus the five I stole from Wilson. Plus the ten I got on margin. You're gonna have to talk to my bankruptcy attorney. Unless… There is a way that you can get your money back. Give me the full $200,000.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And extrapolating, tomorrow you'll owe just shy of $1 million.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's your own fault. You forced me to go with the options here. Your damn anger issues are screwing with my finances. Regular stock this time, nice and safe.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'm not angry. I don't know if you're trying to make me angry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You refuse to bet on yourself. That means low self-esteem.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: So if I give you $200,000, I'll feel smart and pretty.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Low self-esteem can be brought on by exposure to one's relatives. Nice clothes and anger… Classic symptoms. Family gathering. You were late the other day 'cause you were having breakfast with Grammy Adams or Cousin Itt. And she was nagging you about finding a husband.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ah, ah, ah, ah! No spoilers. They ruin everything.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Pulmonology was that way.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Our patient's lung problem is not a lung problem. It's a brain problem. We're consulting with Neurology.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: That's my old boss. You don't actually think this is neurological.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know what it is. Maybe I should just accept the patient's death, if getting help can lead to awkwardness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dr. Andrews. My associates. Doctors Adams and Park.

utterance.speaker: Andrews
utterance.content: Ah. Nice to meet you, Dr. Adams. Hello, Dr. Park.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Micropsia, bleeding, tachycardia, and difficulty breathing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cute butt, huh?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Can we go now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You really wanna turn your back on this guy? Sorry. Carry on.

utterance.speaker: Andrews
utterance.content: Uh… well… It sounds like there could be spinal cord involvement. Have you considered normal pressure hydrocephalus?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, normal pressure hydrocephalus going once. Normal pressure hydrocephalus going twice…

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's not his spinal cord, it's the wiring between his heart and his brain. Autonomic dysregulation syndrome. You do a tilt table test, see how his heart rate responds. That'll confirm.

utterance.speaker: Andrews
utterance.content: Well, if he has normal pressure hydrocephalus, a tilt table test could put him in a coma.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Then it's a good thing he has A.D.S.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you really believe in this diagnosis? Because if this is just a pissing contest, you are at a severe anatomical disadvantage.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's autonomic dysregulation syndrome.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No… it's normal pressure hydrocephalus. Do a spinal fluid test to confirm.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We're doing the tilt table.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: That makes sense. You'd rather have House fire you than Foreman?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: This bet's got to be a test. See if I can handle working with him. I need to prove I have the confidence to disobey him.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Do you have any medical justification for your diagnosis?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: The symptoms fit, and Andrews is a hack. Do you think I'm right?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No… you need to go prepare for your hearing.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: 15 more minutes, Mr. Barton.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A skin resurfacing laser is missing.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And why are you asking me about it?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Because you work for House.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What would House want with a skin resurfacing laser?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I have no idea. Have you seen it?

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: My feet feel hot.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: That's completely normal. No, but House has been talking about how badly he wants to remove those prison tats.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's a very expensive machine, and I'd like it back. Please tell me if you hear anything.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How expensive?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: $200,000. He took it.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Park's hearing's about to start.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're covering for him. I did the same thing many times. My advice to you — figure out what line you aren't willing to cross for him. Because, eventually, he'll ask you to cross it.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How are your feet? Mr. Barton? Can you hear me, Mr. Barton? Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We have convened the disciplinary committee to decide the appropriate action that should be taken against Dr. Chi Park as a result of her actions on October 7th of this year. Dr. Park, do you have an opening statement.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Dr. Foreman, members of the committee, thank you for giving me this opportunity to speak to you today, I…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's not yours to fire.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You guys better fire her for insubordination, 'cause she went rogue, and my patient is now in a coma.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'm the one who did the test.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No, it was my idea!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Seriously, House?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: At least I'm smart enough to know what I don't know. She went out of her way to defy me! She needs— Damn it, you should just fire her!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: My apologies. My apologies, Dr. Park. Dr. House's comments will, of course, have no bearing on this hearing. Please continue.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I can't believe you did that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right back at ya. Our patient's dying. We need theories.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's gotta be normal pressure hydrocephalus. Andrews predicted the coma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, but even a broken doctor's right twice a day. Patient wasn't wet, wobbly, or wacky. Coma had to be a lucky guess.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: If you didn't think he was right, then why did you want us to collect his spinal fluid?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't. I wanted you to do a tilt table test.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You have a wonderful way of communicating.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I knew Park wanted to do a tilt table. She listens to me, I waste an hour. If she defies me… Then I get the test I want and my 100 bucks. Up high.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're angry.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Yes! Now I'm angry. Let's run the test for normal pressure hydrocephalus.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. What else would explain our symptoms and make our patient go into a coma during that test? How 'bout hepatic encephalopathy?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No, we already tested his liver enzymes. They're normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or his liver's so far gone it can't even produce enzymes.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: That's desperate. Fits the symptoms. And Andrews is a hack. Go biopsy to confirm. Unless you want your own hearing.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You'd have to hire me first.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So you do realize that it is unacceptable to hit someone in the workplace?

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Is this theory more promising than the others?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We'll know in a few hours. How are you holding up?

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Other than the fact that my dad's in a coma… Terrible. Tomorrow morning, I am supposed to sign a piece of paper that will… move the company and cost thousands of employees their jobs.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I thought you'd rather see the company go under in New Jersey than thrive in China.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: It's what my dad wants. And it's still his company. I'm really just keeping the seat warm. But unless he wakes up before tomorrow, it's gonna be my signature on that piece of paper.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You don't have to sign it. I'll let you know when we have the results.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Biopsy was clean. It's not his liver. I also ran the spinal fluid test, and you were right that Andrews was wrong. His ICP was not normal. It was elevated. What about HTLV?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We ruled that out three days ago.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Because of his heart problems, but—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Once something gets taken off the board, I'm the only one who's allowed to put it back on.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You owe me 106,804 Yuan. Or $100 U.S.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: God, but you're petty. Okay, so… two options. Either we figure out what's wrong with this guy, or we figure out how to make this company profitable in New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Eastern equine encephalitis?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Brain scans indicate it could be Loa loa disease.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ah, shut it off!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apparently we're allowed to do this now.

utterance.speaker: Ortho doctor
utterance.content: Get out of here, House!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This diagnosis was brought to you by the letter "Y."

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Dad… God, you're okay.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: I'm thirsty.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's a side effect of not dying. Turns out your blood was getting thick and syrupy. Complexes of large, y-shaped antibodies were clogging up your blood vessels, causing your organs to shut down one by one. Now, usually with hyperviscosity syndrome, it's caused by an elevated blood count or protein count. Yours eluded us 'cause it was caused by antibodies from your rheumatoid arthritis. Now that they're being filtered out, the blood would be… a little less duck sauce and a little more soy sauce.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: So I'm gonna be completely cured.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not all about you. Your stock price will be completely cured. Once you sign this. It's a press release. It says that you're healthy, you're going back to work, and you're signing the lease that officially moves the company to China.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: He just woke up. Dad, you don't have to deal with this right now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ah, mm, yeah, actually… he does. 'Cause the market opens at 9:00 a.m. And this means a lot to me. You may remember me from the time I saved your life.

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: If you move it, it'll be without me.

utterance.speaker: Barton
utterance.content: I know you object. I know you disagree with—

utterance.speaker: Ainsley
utterance.content: Dad… I can't do it. If this is really about family, you will not do this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got lucky this time.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, you didn't. I made this bet so you'd stop actively trying to fire Park so you'd be neutral. You went out of your way to help her. She obviously earned your respect, passed whatever test you—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I sabotaged her hearing. You do read the school paper, don't you?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you had sabotaged her hearing, she would have gotten more than a slap on the wrist. What you actually did was make her emotional and make the board members see her as a victim.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause the panel feels badly for incompetent doctors who nearly kill people.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You know that everyone on that panel hates you. You know the minute you recommend firing anyone, they start discussing how big a bonus to give them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's just hurtful. The fact is, winning $100 from you gives me more pleasure than winning $100 from her. Here's your five grand.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What five grand?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just take it. Trust me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Found her sleeping in the park. Said she ran away because her daddy didn't love her. And that is exactly what happened… as far as you can prove.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Congratulations. You're not going to jail… today. But you do know I just can't let this slide. You need to keep up your rep.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. Clinic hours. I'll double them.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay. 12 hours a week.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No… Three times two equals six.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And 3 times 2 times 2 is 12. I know about your deal with Adams.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Call Chase and Taub. Get 'em in here. The boys are back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This check is for significantly more than what I told you it would take to fund the department.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You paged me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You caught your boyfriend cheating that morning. You had a big fight. That's why you were late. You re-pitched an S.T.D. You haven't gotten two consecutive minutes without using the word "loyalty," which explains the anger and the low self-esteem, and the desire to feel pretty… after having been rejected explains the clothes.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It wasn't my boyfriend. It was my husband. I was at my lawyer's office signing the divorce papers.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. I missed the fact that you were married.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We've been separated for almost a year.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So… old news? No anger left? It's all bought and paid for.
